meanings.definition: A small recreational boat propelled by pedals.
meanings.sent1: We rented a pedalo and paddled around the calm lake.
meanings.sent2: The children had fun pedaling the pedalo on the pond.
meanings.sent3: The pedalo race at the summer camp was full of laughter and excitement.
meanings.sent4: Her pedalo glided gracefully across the water like a swan.
meanings.sent5: The bright yellow pedalo stood out against the blue water.

meanings.definition: To ride or operate a pedalo.
meanings.sent1: I love to pedalo with my friends on weekends.
meanings.sent2: They decided to pedalo along the coast for some exercise.
meanings.sent3: He tried to pedalo backwards just for fun but ended up going in circles.
meanings.sent4: Pedaling the pedalo felt like cycling on water.
meanings.sent5: She pedaloed swiftly towards the dock to avoid the approaching storm.
